newsitem.title: UK: Eurobond focus firmly on dollars with more to come.
newsitem.headline: Eurobond focus firmly on dollars with more to come.

text.p: Dollar bonds continued to be the favoured Euromarket currency, with three significant transactions launched on Monday.
Japan-guaranteed Japan Finance Corp for Municipal Enterprises (JFM) issued a $400 million 10-year bond at 23 basis points over U.S. Treasury notes.
Bankers said the pricing was fair -- with a 10-year Asian Development Bank bond trading at 18 b.p. over -- but there was an overhang of supply in the sector.
"JFM is an attractive deal but some investors have been put off by the large amount of recent supply in 10 years," a trader at a European bank said.
"It won't start to perform for a few days," he said.
An official at lead manager Merrill Lynch said despite the large quantity of 10-year paper around, JFM appealed because it was the only government-guaranteed borrower.
"It has been a long time since a Japan-guaranteed borrower has tapped the market," the official said.
"At 23 b.p. over JFM looks good value. There has been a lot of interest from Asian investors in particular, with around 50 percent of the bonds placed there."
Abbey National's $400 million three-year bond was favoured by traders over Hitachi Credit Corp's $200 million five-year bond, which was considered slightly too tight.
On Tuesday, the Inter-American Development Bank (IADB) will issue a $500 million five-year bond. Spread talk was seven basis points over U.S. Treasury notes.
Dow Chemical could launch a $300 million five-year at 31 b.p. over via DKB and Merrill Lynch.
On Wednesday, Bank Nederlandse Gemeenten might bring a $750 million to $1.0 billion five-year bond at around 10 b.p. over.
On Thursday, Russia's 10-year bond for at least $1.0 billion is expected to surface. Spread talk was around 375 b.p. over.
